text:
Ayo friendos, question:
I am new to GraphQL but I can see how it could save me _so much_ time and unecessary looping.
however, I am a little lost on the CRM.deal_collections filter
my goal is to say "I am passing you 1 or more deal IDs, return back to me [deal information] and also [line item information] (and eventually some company data too but that's less important right now)"
using the explorer I got it to work for a single deal lookup, but I am confused by the filter
hs_object_id__in when using the deal_collections
from my reading online, this should accept an array, but in the explorer it seems to expect a string that it converts to a single number
is there a better way to say 'this group of deals'?

Ah-ha! Answered my own question, and it came down to my being a novice at graphql. I fed it a string, and if it gets a string, it wants it to be a number. When I removed the quotes and gave it the real array, it did it, sick, this is (hopefully) going to save me so much time
Stored in dedicated dynamoDB tables with fine-grained least-privilege IAM security and logging
